docs.lead_paragraph: A shift by the federal government in how it pays for drugs for dialysis patients may have had an unintended and potentially dire consequence, researchers say.

headline.seo: Dialysis Rule Changes Followed by Transfusion Increases
headline.main: Unintended Consequence for Dialysis Patients as Drug Rule Changes
headline.print_headline: Unintended Consequence for Dialysis Patients as Drug Rule Changes

docs.abstract: Research by the United States Renal Data System finds that a shift in the Medicare reimbursement policy for drugs to treat dialysis patients has caused a significant jump in the rate of blood transfusions; more frequent transfusions put dialysis patients at a greater risk for organ transplant failure.
docs.snippet: A shift by the federal government in how it pays for drugs for dialysis patients may have had an unintended and potentially dire consequence, researchers say.

docs.lead_paragraph: Polish judicial professionals concluded that the conservative drug law wasn't effective in fighting the drug trade.

headline.main: Saying No to Costly Drug Laws
headline.print_headline: Saying No to Costly Drug Laws

docs.snippet: Polish judicial professionals concluded that the conservative drug law wasn't effective in fighting the drug trade.

headline.main: An Endless Quest for Weight-Loss Pills

docs.abstract: The weight-loss field is strewn with lemons, more so than other areas of medicine, and because of the enormous potential market for these drugs, pharmaceutical companies rush new drugs to market after conducting only small clinical trials, writes Dr. Danielle Ofri.
